News.Title: Electrotherm Reports Q3 FY26 Loss of ₹35.50 Crores
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) Limited posted a net loss of ₹35.50 crores for Q3 FY26 compared to profit of ₹88.05 crores in Q3 FY25. Revenue declined 16.42% to ₹903.79 crores.

News.Title: Electrotherm Clarifies Volume Surge to BSE
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) Limited responds to BSE surveillance inquiry regarding significant increase in trading volume, stating the surge is purely market driven with no specific company-related reasons identified.

News.Title: Electrotherm India Reports Mixed Q2 Results with Revenue Growth but Faces Loan Default Issues
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) Limited announced its quarterly results for the quarter and half year ended September 30, 2025. The company reported revenue from operations of Rs 814.26 crores for the quarter compared to Rs 813.68 crores in the same period last year. Net profit after tax was Rs 21.71 crores for the quarter versus Rs 46.20 crores in the previous year. However, the company defaulted on loan repayment of Rs 6.00 crores plus Rs 2.45 crores interest to Invent Assets Securitisation Reconstruction Private Limited, though the lender agreed to reschedule payments subject to 11% annual interest with full clearance required by December 31, 2025. The auditors qualified their opinion due to non-provision of interest on loan accounts classified as non-performing assets, with unprovided interest totaling Rs 988.94 crores as of the reporting date. The company has settled some previous loan obligations with Rare Asset Reconstruction Limited but reconciliation processes are ongoing.

News.Title: Electrotherm India Reports Q2 Net Loss of 217M Rupees, Revenue Flat at 8B Rupees
News.Summary: Electrotherm India reported a Q2 net loss of 217 million rupees, an improvement from the previous year's loss of 463 million rupees. Revenue remained unchanged at 8 billion rupees compared to the same period last year. However, the company's EBITDA shifted from a gain of 675 million rupees in the previous year to a loss of 120 million rupees in Q2.

News.Title: Electrotherm India Defaults on Rs 10.45 Crore Loan Payment to Asset Reconstruction Company
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) Limited defaulted on loan payments totaling Rs 10.45 crore as of September 30, 2025. The default includes Rs 8 crore in principal and Rs 2.45 crore in interest owed to Invent Assets Securitisation & Reconstruction Private Limited, which acquired debts from Allahabad Bank (now Indian Bank) and Punjab National Bank. The company has a settlement agreement with the ARC for Rs 180 crore in principal over 11 years at 11% interest rate. Electrotherm's total outstanding borrowings from banks and financial institutions stand at Rs 1,091.66 crore, while total financial indebtedness reaches Rs 1,106.16 crore. The company has entered into settlement arrangements with asset reconstruction companies after banks assigned their loans to these entities.

News.Title: Electrotherm India Appoints New Internal Auditor and Relocates Registered Office
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) Limited's Board of Directors approved several key decisions during their October 24, 2025 meeting. The company appointed N R P S & Associates LLP as its new Internal Auditor effective November 15, 2025 through March 31, 2026, replacing RSM Astute Consultech Private Limited whose services will cease on October 31, 2025. The Board also approved shifting the company's registered office from Satellite Road to Bodakdev in Ahmedabad, effective November 1, 2025, to a property owned by Executive Vice Chairman Shailesh Bhandari. Additionally, the company acknowledged fines imposed by NSE and BSE on August 29, 2025 for non-compliance with board composition requirements during the quarter ended June 30, 2025, noting that the issue was resolved after appointing an additional director in April 2025.

News.Title: Electrotherm India Executes Consultancy Agreement with Related Parties
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) Limited has executed a Consultancy Agreement with Prandev Tech Limited (formerly known as Electrotherm Tech Limited) and Mr. Mukesh Bhandari on August 6, 2025. The transaction is classified as a related party transaction. The company had previously informed about this development through a Board Meeting outcome letter dated July 29, 2025, which included the required regulatory details.

News.Title: Electrotherm India Board Approves Quarterly Results, Reappoints Managing Directors, and Proposes Share Capital Restructuring
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) Limited's Board of Directors approved unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, showing revenue from operations of Rs 834.05 crores compared to Rs 1,059.38 crores in the same quarter last year. Net profit after tax was Rs 27.67 crores versus Rs 108.81 crores in the previous year quarter. The Board approved reappointment of Mr. Shailesh Bhandari as Managing Director designated as Executive Vice Chairman for five years from February 1, 2026 to January 31, 2031, and Mr. Suraj Bhandari as Managing Director for five years from November 13, 2025 to November 12, 2030, both subject to shareholder approval. The company proposed reclassifying its authorized share capital of Rs 78.59 crores to comprise Rs 53.59 crores in equity shares and Rs 25 crores in preference shares. The Board also approved a Rs 75 crore technical consultancy agreement with Prandev Tech Limited and Mr. Mukesh Bhandari for two years. Additionally, the company noted fines imposed by NSE and BSE for non-compliance with board composition requirements, which has since been rectified.

News.Title: Electrotherm India Reports Sharp Decline in Q1 Profitability
News.Summary: Electrotherm India reported Q1 net profit of 277 million rupees, down from 1.1 billion rupees in the same period last year. Revenue fell to 8.3 billion rupees from 10.6 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA declined to 520 million rupees compared to 1.3 billion rupees previously, with EBITDA margin compressing to 6.24% from 12.56% in the prior year period.

News.Title: Electrotherm (India) Faces PMLA Order for Asset Retention
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) has announced that it has received an order related to the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) for asset retention. The company has disclosed this information, indicating potential legal or regulatory action concerning its assets.

News.Title: Electrotherm (India) Reports Q4 Financial Results
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) has reported its Q4 financial results. The company's revenue decreased to 11.6 billion rupees from 12.2 billion rupees year-over-year. Q4 EBITDA fell to 644.6 million rupees from 1.31 billion rupees, with EBITDA margin dropping to 5.55% from 10.75%. Profit before tax (PBT) decreased to 465.2 million rupees from 1.04 billion rupees. However, consolidated net profit increased to 1.86 billion rupees from 1.04 billion rupees year-over-year and 883.4 million rupees quarter-over-quarter. The company reported an exceptional item of 1.07 billion rupees.

News.Title: Electrotherm (India) Reports Q3 Consolidated Net Profit of 880 Million Rupees
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) has announced its financial results for the third quarter. The company reported a consolidated net profit of 880 million rupees, which represents a year-over-year decrease from 1.07 billion rupees in the same quarter of the previous year.

News.Title: Electrotherm (India) Permitted to Operate Bank Accounts Following Enforcement Directorate Search
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) has reported that the High Court has granted permission for the company to operate its bank accounts exceeding 336.7 million rupees. This development follows a search conducted by the Directorate of Enforcement. The court's decision allows the company to resume normal financial operations despite the ongoing investigation.

News.Title: Electrotherm (India) Repays 2.25 Billion Rupees to Central Bank of India
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) has made a payment of 2.25 billion rupees to the Central Bank of India by December 31. This repayment suggests the company is addressing its financial obligations to the bank.

News.Title: Electrotherm (India) Reports Q2 Results and Stake Sale
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) reported a net profit of 463 million rupees in Q2, down from 677 million rupees year-over-year and 1.1 billion rupees quarter-over-quarter. Revenue for Q2 was 8 billion rupees, compared to 9.85 billion rupees in the same quarter last year. The company has also approved the sale of its entire 80.49% stake in ET Elec-trans.

News.Title: Electrotherm India to Sell Majority Stake in ET Elec-Trans
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) has approved the sale of its entire 80.49% stake in ET Elec-Trans. This decision represents a significant divestment for the company, potentially impacting its business structure and future operations.

News.Title: Electrotherm (India) Reports Q2 Financial Results
News.Summary: Electrotherm (India) has announced its Q2 financial results. The company reported a net profit of 463 million rupees, which is lower compared to 677 million rupees in the same quarter last year (YoY) and 1.1 billion rupees in the previous quarter (QoQ). The company's revenue for Q2 stood at 8 billion rupees, down from 9.85 billion rupees in the same period last year.
